body.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves: The Road to Neverwinter
body.description: Discover the thrilling origin stories of the bard Edgin, the barbarian Holga, and their whole adventuring party in this official prequel to Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves.Edgin Darvis’s life is a mess. All that he has left are his lute, his dashing good looks, and his daughter, Kira. After a chance encounter with badass bruiser Holga, Edgin is forced to take a hard look at his bad choices. But the road to redemption is long and paved with unforeseen expenses. Fortunately, the world is full of rich fools begging to be parted from their money.And so Edgin and Holga do what any sensible entrepreneurs would do—they form a crew.Joined by the charming rogue Forge Fitzwilliam and Simon, a sorcerer with an intense inferiority complex, the team sets out to line their pockets with both well-earned and ill-gotten gold. Together, Edgin’s crew battles monsters across the realms: gnoll raiders, fey witches, and more fall beneath their sharp weapons and sharper wit. But when they encounter a new, more sophisticated villain, keen blades and piercing blue eyes may not be enough.Their target? Torlinn Shrake, a wealthy eccentric known for abusing his servants and hosting lavish parties.The plan? Play dress-up, sneak into the Shrake estate, and fill their pockets with as much loot as they can carry.The catch? Shrake is hiding a terrible secret: one that could endanger the lives of everyone Edgin has come to care for—even if the loot is too good to pass up. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Well written story setting up the forgotten realms into the popular movie. Great origin story for the group, I am looking for more on this topic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better than most prequel books
reviews.reviewText: Much more enjoyable than most prequel novels. Also unlike other prequel novels, it actually includes most of the main characters from the film.Love this origin story of how the group forms and goes on an adventure together.However, what I REALLY want to read is the story of Forge's betrayal of the group!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great way to get acquainted with the characters of the upcoming movie!
reviews.reviewText: A tie-in to the upcoming movie Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves, "The Road to Neverwinter" by Jaleigh Johnson narrates the start of the merry little band of scoundrels that are the main characters.Former bard, Edgin, is a widower in charge of Kira, his little daughter. He befriends Holga, a human warrior, and together they raise Kira as a small family. He will also meet Forge, an older human who will also join the group. Together they take on a small quest and are joined by Simon, a half-elf sorcerer who will lead them to their biggest score yet: the mansion of a renowned Wizard.But things are not what they seem, and the party they attend is a reunion the likes of nobody's ever seen. Magic, music and puzzles are just the start of a fantastic tale that will have them battling one of the greatest monsters of the pantheon.Written in a fast and fun way, the novel is full of action, but also depth for the characters, and narrates the transformation of a group of unknowns into a small family. It's a great way for you to get immersed, or rekindle your passion for the fantastic world of Forgotten Realms and I can't wait for the movie to be released.Recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a great read
reviews.reviewText: Ordered and read this in preparation for the movie, which I saw, yesterday thanks to being a Prime Member.So often, I find book adaptations or prequels to differ a great deal from the film. This is not the case, here. Not only are the characters faithful to their onscreen performances, they are faithful to the source material and concepts behind them.The author does not overburden us with descriptions and the backstories are good enough that you get a sense of the characters and feel invested in them, while leaving you wanting to know more about them, and look forward to seeing their further adventures. They are fleshed out very well.I would definitely look forward to reading more, if the author was authorized to make a series for these characters, as I do not feel anything was taken away from the movie or would be taken away, by doing so.As another note, the author was quite failthful to the Forgotten Realms setting and that impressed me, as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An enjoyable movie prequel
reviews.reviewText: Movie prequels are tricky to pull off, limited things you can do/reveal with/about the characters, and such. So I grade them with a +1.5 curve.That being said, this was a good read.*Not blow your mind and change your world good, but popcorn good.There are certain things that I expect from a prequel.-Introduce the characters in a "believable" and organic way-Check.-Make me feel as though I know these characters and understand their modivations-Yep.-Weave those things into a story that I want to know the outcome-Nailed it.*I'm not sure how this would read after watching the movie, but I think it would be fine but a little less so.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good story, but i don't get why a rogue doesn't carry his own weapon. Running after monsters unarmed? Going into obviously dangerous places with nothing? Stupid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars An okay tie in
reviews.reviewText: I watched the movie first. Most of the characters come across as they do in the first part of the movie. With some exceptions for the book taking place some time before the movie. Buy cheap.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a fun story! Filled with adventure and a great cast of characters. I read this before I saw the movie Honor Among Thieves and I'm glad I did. It was the perfect "prequel" story for the movie. The story was filled with thrilling adventures and a heist gone wrong at the end. Lots of great moments throughout. Highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Mediocre tie in to a super fun film
reviews.reviewText: It's an alright movie prequel. It makes you more familiar with the lead characters but offers very little in character growth. Kira is not written like a 9 year old kid, which is not great. Maybe the author didn't have good notes for the movie script as things are about to take a shift in personality. Forge is written as a part of the family... in the movie, he has some different goals. The story is fine, it has some good d&d creatures show up. I felt a little underwhelmed, but it was an enjoyable and quick read.
